comment.body:
@nirname I just can't understand why coverage seems to drop randomly...

The number of files and the percentage change seems to be different each time and have no relation to my changes. Sometimes it is up, sometimes it is down.

Any ideas?

![Coverage decrease across indirectly affected files](https://github.com/mermaid-js/mermaid/assets/1826451/ee553adc-f05b-42a6-b241-adfbe2b783cc)

pull_request.title: Bug/4912 GitGraph routing and colouring for merges and cherry-picks
pull_request.body:
## :bookmark_tabs: Summary

Fixes issues with colouring and routing of merges in GitGraph.

Resolves #4912 

## :straight_ruler: Design Decisions

- Changed commit variable names `commit1` and `commit2` to `commitA` and `commitB` respectively, to prevent confusion with `seq` property values (which are also numbers and used to ID the commits).
- Refactored `hasOverlappingCommits` function to be easier to read and renamed it `shouldRerouteArrow`:
  - Used `Array.some()` instead of `Array.filter()` (should increase performance with larger graphs, if needed)
  - Swapped out `Object.keys()` for `Object.values()`
  - It takes a new argument: the name of the branch which would receive the arrow's curve and thereby causing issues for overlapping commits.
- Introduced branch colour assignments to each conditional check for routing.
- New e2e tests (many based on reviews by @nirname and @mathbraga)
- Added more sample diagrams to demo folder show how the graphs should look in different situations.

### :clipboard: Tasks

Make sure you

- [x] :book: have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/mermaid-js/mermaid/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md)
- [x] :computer: have added necessary unit/e2e tests.
- [x] :notebook: have added documentation. Make sure [`MERMAID_RELEASE_VERSION`](https://github.com/mermaid-js/mermaid/blob/develop/packages/mermaid/src/docs/community/development.md#3-update-documentation) is used for all new features.
- [x] :bookmark: targeted `develop` branch

repo.name: mermaid
repo.description: Generation of diagrams like flowcharts or sequence diagrams from text in a similar manner as markdown

comment.body:
Hi, thanks for taking a look. I originally wanted to keep the number of new arguments passed to `shouldRerouteArrow` to a minimum. But you're right: I could pass it `p1` and `p2` and do the calculation for `branchToGetCurve` inside `shouldRerouteArrow`. I can try that out.

I don't think comparing `seq` would be the same -- that would only tell you whether the one commit comes before or after the other on the branch, but here we need to know whether one commit is above or below the other (or in `TB` to the left or right), to know whether the normal branch curve will be a problem or cause a conflict that needs rerouting.

issue.title: Links to the documentation from mermail.live are broken

labels.name: Type: Bug / Error
labels.description: Something isn't working or is incorrect

labels.name: Status: Triage
labels.description: Needs to be verified, categorized, etc

issue.body:
### Description

When editing diagram in [mermaid.live](https://mermaid.live) docs button is supposed to lead me directly to the documentation for the graph type I am editing. Now it leads only to the main page. Seems that rerouting inside documentation is broken.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open mermaid.live
2. Pick any of sample diagrams
3. Click "docs" button


### Screenshots

![image](https://github.com/mermaid-js/mermaid/assets/2842432/d42bd3d4-839c-4913-8b12-5563b1c55323)


### Code Sample

These links are broken

```text
https://mermaid.js.org/#/sequenceDiagram
https://mermaid.js.org/#/flowchart
https://mermaid.js.org/#/classDiagram
```

etc...
did not have checked each and every

### Setup

- Mermaid version: 10.6.0 (on the documentation website)
- Browser and Version: Chrome

### Suggested Solutions

- Either fix links inside live editor (https://mermaid.live)
- Or fix redirects on the main documentation website (https://mermaid.js.org)

### Additional Context

_No response_

issue.title: Partial overlap of flowchart subgraph

labels.name: Status: Triage
labels.description: Needs to be verified, categorized, etc

issue.body:
### Proposal

Mermaidjs should allow flowchart subgraphs to overlap to display complex groupings.
I propose that the `end` keyword is able to take the identifier of a subgraph as parameter to close. It should remain the current functionality when no argument is given. Placing the identifier after `end` could cause issues with the parser confusing it with new declarations, therefore I suggest the following Regex as syntax: `end:\s?ID`.


### Example

```
flowchart TD
    subgraph one
    a
    subgraph two
    b
    end one
    c
    subgraph three
    d
    end two
    e
    end three
    
    a --> b --> c --> d --> e
```

### Screenshots

![image](https://github.com/mermaid-js/mermaid/assets/51381523/a95432dd-0405-403d-9ea7-bbabd7606f35)
